basic.description: Rock-water interaction and geological controls on chemical evolution and anthropogenic modification of surface and ground waters. Thermodynamics, activity diagrams and computer models are applied to problems of water contamination. Students evaluate and design solutions to case studies, including geochemical hazards to human health and environmental impacts of mining, including acid mine drainage. (Offered jointly with GEOL-485).
basic.subject: GEOL
basic.title: Environmental Aqueous Geochem.
